  • Method Details

    • executeOperation

      public abstract void executeOperation() throws PlayerNotInListException, CloudNotInListException, NotExpertModeException, NotEnoughCoinsException, NotPlayerTurnException, ZeroTowersRemainedException, NotEnoughIslandsException, NotEnoughAssistantCardsException, CharacterCardAlreadyActivatedException, IncorrectOperationException
      common method to execute an operation
      Throws:
      PlayerNotInListException - thrown if the player that executed the operation is not in the player list of the room
      CloudNotInListException - thrown if the cloud selected is not in the list of clouds in the game
      NotExpertModeException - thrown if the player tries to play a character card but the game is not in expert mode
      NotEnoughCoinsException - thrown if the player doesn't have enough coins to play the selected character card
      NotPlayerTurnException - thrown if the server receives an operation from a player that is not the current player turn
      ZeroTowersRemainedException - thrown if a player finishes his towers
      NotEnoughIslandsException - thrown if there are less than four islands in the game
      NotEnoughAssistantCardsException - thrown if a player finishes his assistant cards
      CharacterCardAlreadyActivatedException - thrown if a player tries to activate a character card that has already been played in the current turn
      IncorrectOperationException - thrown if a player tries to do an operation that should not be done in the current phase or the player gives an invalid input

    • checkNickname

      public boolean checkNickname()
      Returns:
      true if the player executing the operation is in the list of players of the game, false otherwise

    • checkCharacterCardCost

      public boolean checkCharacterCardCost(String cardName)
      Parameters:
      cardName - the character card selected by the player
      Returns:
      true if the player has enough coins to activate the selected character card, false otherwise

    • checkMovableStudent

      public void checkMovableStudent() throws IncorrectOperationException
      checks if the player can move another student
      Throws:
      IncorrectOperationException - thrown if the player can't move more students
